news.summary: Las Vegas Sands Corp. (LVS) develops, owns, and operates integrated resorts and convention centers in Macao and Singapore. The casino giant is expected to announce its fiscal fourth-quarter earnings for 2025 in the near term. LVS stock has outperformed the S&P 500
news.article_text:
Las Vegas, Nevada-based Las Vegas Sands Corp. (LVS) develops, owns, and operates integrated resorts and convention centers in Macao and Singapore. With a market cap of $44.1 billion, the company offers a wide range of gaming activities and entertainment as well as overnight accommodations, while its expo centers host a wide range of entertainment shows, expositions, and other activities. The casino giant is expected to announce its fiscal fourth-quarter earnings for 2025 in the near term.

news.article_text:
Jan 8 (Reuters) - Paramount Skydance reiterated that its $108.4 billion bid for Warner Bros Discovery was superior to rival ​Netflix on Thursday, adding that the value of ‌the cable spinoff central to the Netflix offer is effectively worthless.

Warner Bros Discovery's ‌board had on Wednesday rejected Paramount's amended offer that included a $40 billion in equity personally guaranteed by Oracle's co-founder Larry Ellison, the father of Paramount CEO David Ellison, and $54 billion in ⁠debt to fi

news.headline: Paramount Defends Its Hostile Bid for Warner
news.summary: “Paramount’s offer is superior to WBD’s existing agreement with Netflix and represents the best path forward for WBD shareholders,” Paramount said in a letter to shareholders.  Warner on Wednesday had told its shareholders in a public letter that Paramount’s latest offer for the entire company wasn’t superior, “or even comparable,” to the $72 billion Netflix deal for its movie and TV studios and the HBO Max streaming service.  Paramount had amended the most recent bid to include a personal guarantee from billionaire  Larry Ellison,  the father of Paramount Chief Executive  David Ellison,  for $40.4 billion of equity financing.

news.headline: Goldman Sachs nears the end of its years-long consumer headache after clinching Apple Card sale to JPMorgan
news.summary: The deal is expected to be completed by the end of the year. The move is part of a larger plan to end the bank's foray into the consumer lending business.
news.article_text:
Goldman Sachs (GS) has reached an agreement to move its Apple Card business to Chase (JPM) in a deal that brings the company one step closer to ending its years-long foray deeper into the consumer banking business that became a headache for the firm.

“This transaction substantially completes the narrowing of our focus in our consumer business,” Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon said Wednesday in a press release statement.

The deal still requires regulatory approval and isn’t expected to be final

news.headline: UK retailers post mixed performance amid consumer uncertainty

news.article_text:
UK retailers have reported mixed performance to kick off the new year, as economic challenges threaten to dampen consumer activity, creating a more uncertain outlook.

Shares in Primark-owner Associated British Foods (ABF.L) slumped 11% on Thursday morning, after warning it expected to see lower profits.

news.headline: Paramount reiterates its offer for Warner Bros is better than Netflix deal
news.summary: Paramount Skydance reiterated that its $108.4 billion bid for Warner Bros Discovery was superior to rival Netflix's offer. The value of ‌the cable spinoff central to the Netflix offer is effectively worthless. Warner Bros has argued that Paramount's revised December 22 bid "rem
news.article_text:
Jan 8 (Reuters) - Paramount Skydance reiterated that its $108.4 billion bid for Warner Bros Discovery was superior to rival ​Netflix on Thursday, adding that the value of ‌the cable spinoff central to the Netflix offer is effectively worthless.

Warner Bros Discovery's ‌board had on Wednesday rejected Paramount's amended offer that included a $40 billion in equity personally guaranteed by Oracle's co-founder Larry Ellison, the father of Paramount CEO David Ellison, and $54 billion in ⁠debt to fi

news.headline: Paramount Defends Its Hostile Bid for Warner
news.summary: “Paramount’s offer is superior to WBD’s existing agreement with Netflix and represents the best path forward for WBD shareholders,” Paramount said in a letter to shareholders.  Warner on Wednesday had told its shareholders in a public letter that Paramount’s latest offer for the entire company wasn’t superior, “or even comparable,” to the $72 billion Netflix deal for its movie and TV studios and the HBO Max streaming service.  Paramount had amended the most recent bid to include a personal guarantee from billionaire  Larry Ellison,  the father of Paramount Chief Executive  David Ellison,  for $40.4 billion of equity financing.

news.headline: Should You Buy Netflix Stock After Its Recent 32% Plunge?
news.summary: Netflix (NFLX 0.30%) operates the world's largest streaming platform for movies and television shows. Its stock has declined by 32% from its mid-2025 peak, but it's still up 84,837% since its initial public offering (IPO) in 2002
news.article_text:
Investors have a rare opportunity to buy one of America's highest-quality stocks at a steep discount.

Netflix (NFLX 0.30%) operates the world's largest streaming platform for movies and television shows, with over 300 million paying members. The company is using its immense scale and soaring profits to outspend its competition when it comes to creating and licensing content, further cementing its dominance.
